column5: Great story,Thanks for posting.  Backlash
that fish is ridiculously large. congratulations to all involved. Best part is at least they had been fishing muskies for 1 year... unlike Mr. O'Brien

Lew, Dale just told me today that they will have the big girl or " Big Kahuna "  has he calls her that is just a great fitting name for her at the Odyssey for all to see. I cant wait for that show this will be a great year last time the Obrian fish and now the MacNair monster
great comparison even better story....
Thanks Mike, that's good to hear, she'll definetely be the hit of the show.

Thanks to Ken Taggart, our editor of Muskies Canada Relaease Journal, has made this special issue available on line.  You can view it at: http://www.muskiescanada.ca/ click on the Breaking News link.  It is a PDF file so you will need Adobe reader to view it.  You can also listen to a phone conversation with Dale at:  http://muskie.outdoorsfirst.com/board/foru...s=5&start=1   Truly a magnificent Muskie that was caught and released.  Congrats Dale!   Cheers, Ron...
Thanks for that, Ron. Much appreciated.
Thanks so much Ron, a great read!
Sweet OFC made the article!!!!  To bad it was about people being jackasses and wasting 6 pages arguing about the size of the fish...
Wow...stared at that pic for a long time. What a beast!!!

That telephone interview is certainly a MUST LISTEN!  It's as good as video. Thank you to all who put it together and a special thanks to Dale MacNair for his generosity in letting everyone share his spectacular event.  Edit: I just put a post-it note over my avatar.
i'm happy to know that this fish was live release  good job dale man
wow great interview
Just finish listening to the interview. Great story Thanks Ron.

Thanks for posting Ron! World record or not, who really cares? It's so nice to see a fish that size go back into the water. It was a shame to see the skeptics spewing and the begrudging bloviating. -Brian

I bet I will have to listen to it many times over as I would get distracted when Dale was talking I would be thinking of that big girl on the end of my line and then realize that I was just listening to a story what a great recording.  Once again congratz dale.  The on line journal looks great also
great interview, thanks for posting.
Thanks Ron !  Maina's gonna have to pump up the injection moulding machines now !!
Fantastic story, thanks for posting!
Thanks Ron.  I like the interview.

Excellent interview and you could hear the excitement in his voice as he re-lived the fight.  Sounds like their gonna have the reproduction done fairly fast and seeing as Dale lives in Ontario, I wonder if there's any chance he'll have it at the Musky Odyssey in April ??

Lew I bet he will have it there at the MCI booth that will bring alot of people over and be great to here the story all day long. I just hope he does not do the carp show in Ottawa if its the same weekend that would really suck if I find out I will let ya know here
Thanks Ron, great interview.  Joey
fantastic interview.....
Thanks for posting that Ron!!
WOW!
What would be the weight on that girl?
That is a real good story of the thought process involved in catching that historical muskie. Caught on the 10 inch Jake no less! Thanks for providing this.
There's a few different calculators around and they all put that pretty lady well over 60 pounds, but nobody will ever know for sure.  VERY BIG is probably close enough
What an awesome interview!!!...started to get my heart pumpin'!!!....thanks for sharing that with us Ron!!!
